news.Title: [AI Summary] 采鈺股價近一週小幅上漲，公司近期公告多項營運與人事變動
news.Content: • 采鈺 (6789.TW) 近一週股價上漲 1.90%，最新收盤價為 268.00 元，顯示市場對公司近期動態持觀望態度。, • 公司於 11 月 26 日完成限制員工權利新股收回註銷的實收資本額變更登記，減少了資本額與流通在外股數 [1]。, • 采鈺於 11 月 13 日公告將斥資 3.18 億元訂購龍潭廠廠務工程設施與設備，顯示公司對未來擴張的布局 [3]。, • 此外，公司於 11 月 14 日公告法人代表董事異動，由台灣積體電路製造股份有限公司指派新任董事徐宏仁 [2]，並於 11 月 12 日預告將參與 11 月 13 日及 19 日的機構投資人說明會 [4]。, • 采鈺 10 月合併營收為 7.39 億元，年減 18.28% [5]，與股價近期走勢呈現區間震盪。 【綜合分析】 參考來源：Yahoo奇摩股市: 5則 | 資料期間：2025-11-10 至 2025-11-26 | 新聞數量：5 則 采鈺 (6789.TW) 在 2025 年 11 月中旬至下旬期間，股價呈現溫和上漲趨勢，近一週漲幅達 1.90%，最新收盤價為 268.00 元，但近期股價略有回檔，前一日收盤價為 270.00 元。在此期間，公司發布了多項重要公告，涵蓋營運、資本結構及人事異動等方面，顯示公司營運正逐步推進。 在資本結構方面，采鈺於 11 月 26 日公告，限制員工權利新股收回註銷已完成實收資本額變更登記。此舉將使公司實收資本額略為減少至新台幣 3,182,991,190 元，流通在外股數也隨之降低 [1]。此類資本操作通常旨在優化股東權益結構或反映實際股權狀況。 營運與擴張方面，采鈺於 11 月 13 日揭露了一項重大的廠務工程設施與設備採購計畫，預計將投入新台幣 3.18 億元用於龍潭廠的建設與升級 [3]。這項投資反映了公司對未來產能擴充或製程優化的積極規劃。 人事方面，采鈺於 11 月 14 日公告，其法人代表董事將進行異動，由台灣積體電路製造股份有限公司（台積電）新指派徐宏仁先生擔任董事，接替原任者李健欣先生 [2]。此一人事變動可能與台積電對采鈺的策略性投資與管理有關。 此外，為增進與資本市場的溝通，采鈺於 11 月 12 日預告將於 11 月 13 日及 19 日分別參加 CLST 及 Macquarie 所舉辦的機構投資人說明會 [4]，這顯示公司積極向外界傳達其營運現況與未來展望。 然而，在營收方面，采鈺公布的 2025 年 10 月合併營收為 7.39 億元，年減 18.28% [5]。此營收數據與近期股價的溫和走勢形成對比，可能意味著市場對於公司長期成長潛力仍抱持期待，或是在等待更明確的營運回升訊號。整體而言，采鈺在經歷了一系列內部調整與對外溝通後，其後續營運表現及股價走勢值得持續關注。

news.Title: [AI Summary] VisEra Stock Sees Modest Weekly Gain Amidst Corporate Updates and Personnel Changes
news.Content: • VisEra (6789.TW) stock rose 1.90% over the past week, with the latest closing price at NT$268.00, indicating a cautious market sentiment towards recent developments. • The company completed the registration for changes in its paid-in capital due to the cancellation of restricted employee stock options on November 26th, reducing both capital and outstanding shares [1]. • VisEra announced on November 13th an order for plant facility and equipment at its Longtan plant, valued at NT$318 million, signaling expansion plans [3]. • Additionally, the company announced a change in its corporate representative director on November 14th, with Mr. Xu Hong-Ren from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company appointed as the new director [2]. VisEra also announced its participation in investor conferences on November 12th, scheduled for November 13th and 19th [4]. • VisEra's consolidated revenue for October 2025 was NT$739 million, a year-on-year decrease of 18.28% [5], reflecting a trading range for its stock. [Analysis] Sources: Yahoo Finance Taiwan: 5 articles | Period: 2025-11-10 to 2025-11-26 | Number of articles: 5 VisEra (6789.TW) experienced a modest upward trend in its stock price from mid to late November 2025, with a weekly gain of 1.90% and a closing price of NT$268.00. However, the stock saw a slight pullback recently, closing at NT$270.00 the previous day. During this period, the company issued several significant announcements covering operations, capital structure, and personnel changes, indicating steady progress in its business. Regarding its capital structure, VisEra announced on November 26th the completion of registration for changes in paid-in capital due to the cancellation of restricted employee stock options. This action will slightly reduce the company's paid-in capital to NT$3,182,991,190 and consequently decrease the number of outstanding shares [1]. Such capital adjustments are typically aimed at optimizing shareholder equity structures or reflecting actual shareholding statuses. In terms of operations and expansion, VisEra revealed on November 13th a substantial plan to procure plant facility and equipment for its Longtan facility, with an investment of NT$318 million [3]. This investment underscores the company's proactive strategy for future capacity expansion or process enhancement. On the personnel front, VisEra announced on November 14th a change in its corporate representative director. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) appointed Mr. Xu Hong-Ren as the new director, succeeding Mr. Li Jian-Xin [2]. This personnel change may be linked to TSMC's strategic investment and management in VisEra. Furthermore, to foster communication with the capital market, VisEra announced on November 12th its participation in investor conferences hosted by CLST on November 13th and by Macquarie on November 19th [4]. This demonstrates the company's active efforts to convey its operational status and future outlook to external stakeholders. However, in terms of revenue, VisEra reported consolidated revenue of NT$739 million for October 2025, a year-on-year decrease of 18.28% [5]. This revenue figure contrasts with the recent mild stock price movement, potentially suggesting that the market holds expectations for the company's long-term growth potential or is awaiting clearer signals of operational recovery. Overall, following a series of internal adjustments and external communications, VisEra's subsequent operational performance and stock price trajectory warrant continued attention.
